source: 211.org, Hawaii DoD Office of Veterans' Services, U.S.VETS, VA Hawaii, Hope Services Hawaii

resources.name: Hawaii 211 - United Way 211
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referrals to 4,000+ community resources including housing, employment, food, health, mental health, and veteran services

resources.name: Office of Veterans' Services - Hawaii DoD
resources.description: State office providing links to veteran resources, benefits information, and support services

resources.name: Matsunaga VA Medical Center
resources.description: VA medical center providing comprehensive healthcare, emergency housing, transitional housing, permanent housing (HUD-VASH), and benefits assistance

resources.name: U.S.VETS Barber's Point
resources.description: On-site transitional, long-term and permanent housing for homeless veterans with employment services through Veterans in Progress program

resources.name: U.S.VETS Wai'anae
resources.description: Only U.S.VETS site providing comprehensive services to both veteran and civilian families, serving nearly 200 men, women and children daily with housing and support

resources.name: Hope Services Hawaii - Veterans Services
resources.description: Community-based organization providing comprehensive support services for veterans including housing assistance, case management, and supportive services

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: National nonprofit providing support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Nonprofit providing complimentary career assistance, job placement services, resume optimization, mentorship, and access to employment board (36K+ jobs)

additional_resources.hud_vash_program: https://www.va.gov/homeless/hud-vash.asp - Housing vouchers with VA services for homeless veterans
additional_resources.kaiser_permanente_grant: Kaiser Permanente offers $50,000 grants for homeless and at-risk veterans
additional_resources.va_benefits: https://www.va.gov/ - Comprehensive VA benefits and healthcare

notes: Hawaii has strong veteran support services through U.S.VETS locations and the VA medical center. Call 211 for local resource referrals or contact the Office of Veterans' Services for state-specific assistance. Many services are free and confidential.
